documents.document: Man it's weird rewatching Band of Brothers and seeing actors I recognize. Who knew Jimmy Fallon was in it?
Apart from that, it seems neat. Everyone seems a bit broken in an interesting way. Reminds me that Twin Peaks isn't far away.
Like haven't we gotten past hearing about the whole student teacher thing and just saying : https://t.co/zugck4Npu1
Feels not great the way statutory rape is treated like some racy plot point in it, though.
Riverdale seems hokey as all get-out, but I think I can get with it. Scratches the same itch as the Scream show did.
The sound proofing is bad enough that either everything is booked up that day, or they just really don't care about any of that stuff.
It's 1986 and both groups just rent some random practice space. They're tired of the stale studios to which they have access.
I want to live in a world where the RUN DMC-Aerosmith "Walk This Way" collaboration actually happened the way it does in the music video.
" a good noun is really good. Like, bear? That's a good one. That sounds good." -@alexanderbkim

That new Scarlet Spider looks like someone took entirely the wrong lessons from Spider Gwen.
I get not having a huge budget for this kind of thing, but does Vancouver just not use salt?
The parts of the sidewalks that were covered in ice when I left town a month ago are still covered in ice. Hope that melted and this is new.

It's snowing, which means I get my one chance to wear long-johns in Vancouver. Today is a good day
@evacsenge No, these were strangers. You were burning up the dancefloor with moves all your own.
I'm at a bar with a dancefloor and someone was just reeled in. Unironically. Like, for sure seriously. As a dance move and not a joke.
